website_summaries.verdict: Dogs have an instinctive desire to chew. Bully sticks are a safe, natural way to satisfy that urge, and give your dog something to occupy his time – but they tend to smell. Best Bully Sticks are a nutritional treat sourced from grass-fed, free-range Angus beef cattle and do have a lower odor than the others on our list, though odor-free is a stretch.
pros: These bully sticks are dried at  a lower temperature for a longer time than regular bully sticks, reducing the moisture and thus the odor
Sourced from Brazil, with no added preservatives or other chemicals
Available in 6-inch 20 pack, 12-inch 12 pack, or 12-inch 24 pack
cons: While these have less odor than many other bully sticks, they do still smell
While your dog will love the aroma, you probably will not

customer_reviews.title: So thin
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to like them. But he will eat anything. There isn't really much of a smell to them, but the reason why I'm giving them only one star is because they are so tiny. They are 12 inch long but as thick as a pen.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: They Stink
customer_reviews.text: The Bully Sticks stunk so bad that we were forced to throw them out. I don't know how the manufacturer makes them odor free but they definitely failed on these. We have been buying them regularly for our aussie but never again
customer_reviews.author: J. May

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the quality?
customer_reviews.text: I cannot find a way to contact the seller. These used to be really good. I don't know if they changed their formula on how they make them but this last batch I received was horrible. Small and thin. Not thick , even the thin ones were a nice thickness. . My dog ate is in a matter of seconds.I won't be ordering from this company anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Broderick

customer_reviews.title: I love the value in the store one stick this size ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy these all the time for my dog she is a 9lb Yorkie. I love the value in the store one stick this size cost anywhere from 7-9$ buying them here cost about $3.90 per stick so huge savings also they are almost odor free and I like that they are natural with no chemicals some sticks you buy have chemicals or glue on them very happy highly recommend these. I have it in my favorites for quick purchase. Also leave them in fridge so they don’t get bacteria on them especially if your dog doesn’t eat the whole stick. They also stay fresh and your dog will love them healthy chew
customer_reviews.author: Cathymta

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control and price increase
customer_reviews.text: For the cost of these I wish they would last longer than they do. The last two bags I received I have been disappointed with -- (1) the price has increased; (2) some have really smelled bad; and (3) there have been at least 2 or 3 in each bag that when my dog would start to chew on them, they started to shred. I had to throw them away so she did swallow the strings that she was pulling off of them. I am going to start looking for a different brand of odor-free bully sticks as the Best Bully sticks are starting to not go through quality control as they should be.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Bully Sticks, No Bull (Made of Real Bull)
customer_reviews.text: Juna is a happy puppy when she has her bully sticks. When one gets super tiny, she plays with it, tossing it up in the air, pouncing on it, just having so much fun. She's trots all over the house with them. She takes them in the car, to her crate, buries them in the backyard. She loves, loves, loves them. Not truly odor-free, but definitely smell better than most dog treats of a similar nature.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa, P.B.A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, good value
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent quality bully sticks, as are the Best Bully pig and cow ears. I have purchased the bully sticks on at least 5 occasions and my Lab loves them. They are not completely odorless, but most of the time they are reasonably-odor free (and really, these are bull pizzles, after all). My last bag turned out to be over the acceptable stink-threshold, however, and I noted that in my seller review. I was pleased and surprised when the seller gave me an unsolicited refund. I would have continued purchasing them regardless (having tried others, this is a good value), but I really appreciated being treated as a valued customer.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Harpy

customer_reviews.title: Very bad!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not happy at all with these bully sticks. I ordered the odor free and they smell terrible. I let the bag air out overnight because my dog hates the odor and 24 hours later they still smell bad. Also the quality is so inconsistent! Some of the bones are so thin they are smaller than a pencil! Others are 3/4” and taper down to almost nothing. The largest bone is 1/2” thick. They are eaten in 3-4 minutes, that’s a very expensive bone for the amount of time it takes to eat it!!! I will be looking for other sources to purchase from! Very unhappy with this company!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Newton

customer_reviews.title: and this is his favorite treat. This is a same brand that I ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog is big chewer, and this is his favorite treat. This is a same brand that I bought before.Huge difference - quantity is the same, but price is higher, and quality is much much worse."Odor-Free" is a joke. Smell is terrible,some of them so dry, that it looks like sticks are about 20 years old. I was so lucky with previous order ( it wasn't Angus beef), struggle to take it away from dog.This time my dog chews few minutes, and loses the interest.
customer_reviews.author: gardener

customer_reviews.title: The quality has changed
customer_reviews.text: We've been keeping this in-stock regularly for our one-year old puppy, and have come to really rely on this brand for value and quality. But the quality of the product in this latest bag has gone seriously downhill. The bullysticks are much thinner, some are short, and the smell has gotten more pungent. These used to be thick, relatively odor free and long-lasting treats. Really really disappointing. Hope that was just a fluke with this bag, but looks like other reviewers have had the same issue. Please keep the quality consistent--we loved this product before!
customer_reviews.author: David Moser

customer_reviews.title: Buy these from chewy not amazon
customer_reviews.text: The bomes to the left are from Amazon and the bones to the right are from chewy. I buy this brand every month for my 10 month old puppy. I usually buy them on chewy but this time amazon had them cheaper. I know there are double thick and regulars but this bag had really thin bones. Mu dog chewed them in under 15 mins. I will not buy these from Amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy another brand in 12" and saw in half but given the $45 these cost I assumed they'd be thicker and of better quality. They are paper thin and, unless you have a toy breed, hilariously not worth the price. I almost think they messed up and gave me the low quality thin ones. Do not buy this product, other brands like nature paws are much better AND $15 cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Spikesmom

customer_reviews.title: Best brand we have tried
customer_reviews.text: Love the 12 inch sticks for my 15 lb dog. He loves having a big stick to carry around and they last a lot longer before I have to throw the nub away at the end. This is the best brand, and we have tried many. The sticks are practically odor free which is a must for us. The sticks are more plump than other brands and all pretty much equal sizes. Other brands have a lot of duds in them, like really skinny sticks and a few good ones...these are all good. This is the brand we will keep buying from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi J

customer_reviews.title: I continue to purchase these for a nightly snack for him since bully sticks make him happy and certainly clean the back of his teeth better ...
customer_reviews.text: These bully sticks are very thin, thinner then my ring finger and sometimes my pinky. My boxer-pitbull will go through them in less then 30 minutes. I go to the store now to select bulky bully sticks for when I need my pup to be distracted for an hour or longer. I continue to purchase these for a nightly snack for him since bully sticks make him happy and certainly clean the back of his teeth better then any dental chew we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Elise DTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Decreased Quality and Size
customer_reviews.text: In the past, we regularly purchased 6 in. Best Bully Sticks for our dogs. They were almost always the perfect size. However, the last several orders the sticks are still 6 in, but are no longer thick and long lasting. The last batch was absolutely pathetic. The sticks were twig thin and the dogs devoured them in less than one minute. That batch was the final straw for Best Bully Sticks for us. I wouldn't have paid $10 for that bag much less the 45 bucks we did pay. Sorry to say, we are no longer customers. We have switched to Natural Farm Bully Sticks and so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bass

customer_reviews.title: Thick thin super all mean- ‘good luck!’ You get what we send you!
customer_reviews.text: These ‘Best’ Bully Sticks should be named ‘crapshoot’ because you never know what you are going to get. They smell horrible when they are supposed to be low odor but mostly they hide how much you are getting as in the weight. 5 thick, 5 super, 5 whatever and they are skinny as a pencil one time and thick as my thumb another. How can these be sold like this? For over $30+ this should not be the case. This is the least regulated product that needs to be I’ve ever seen! You can’t even get a straight answer when you email them. Im no longer buying from this company.
customer_reviews.author: JeanDucksfan

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent product
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth package I’ve purchased, second consecutively via Amazon. This package is in better shape overall compared to the previous one, which was definitely not odor free and came with claw-like misshapen sticks. In this last package there’s some odor but not as offensive and all the sticks are more or less uniform. If my puppy didn’t love it so much, I’d probably give another brand a try. Pictured: (1) last claw-like stick from previous package and (2) uniform sticks from most recent order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chewy for all size dogs
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 6 inch and they are perfect for my smaller dogs. They are not completely odor free but they are not as bad as others I’ve smelled. Despite the low odor it’s a fantastic way to occupy your pups and let them burn off some chewing steam. It really helps with my puppy’s teething. My adult dogs just love it too. I feel comfortable with them Since it’s digestible but I still supervise so they don’t get too small to swallow.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Decent price/not low odor
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good bully sticks. As my dog gets bigger/older he gets through them much quicker which is to be expected. I do like that they are the best value around. I will say they are NOT low odor! What can you expect when you know what a bully stick really made from? With that being said, if you have a sensitive sense of smell, steer clear of your pup when he’s chomping on one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Only received 11, and about half as thick as before.
customer_reviews.text: I used to get these all the time. Now I will look for another brand. To start, my package of 12 only came with 11. Not off to a great start, but much like all the more recent reviews, the latest package I received is about half as thick as they used to be. These used to last my Goldendoodle 30+ minutes; the ones from this package are about 10, if that. Definitely shop elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Scored these as a lightning deal and was super thrilled to see them there
customer_reviews.text: Scored these as a lightning deal and was super thrilled to see them there. My boxer/rotti/amstaff mutt usually finishes bully sticks in minutes, so I love this brand because it takes her about 15 minutes to finish one - which for her is a long time! They don't smell as bad as other ones I've tried, but they are also not totally odor-free. As a lightning deal they were a great score. I'd probably buy them again at full price but I'm hoping they'll come up as another lightning deal. Found my review helpful? Please leave a vote!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria R

customer_reviews.title: Great deal—relatively speaking!
customer_reviews.text: It’s all relative! There is an odor, but not as bad as some. My two 30 pound basenjis love them, the size is perfect, but one bully stick each doesn’t last the evening. Would like something more economical, but relative to the individual fat bully sticks I buy for $13-$14 each, these are a deal! Hard to believe these individual scores end up as a 5, but overall, they do and I’m buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne S

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, Low odor, One small stick out of 12
customer_reviews.text: Many of the reviews mention small sticks. The package I received had one of the twelve sticks that I would consider small. However, my dog still loved it. The remaining sticks were a good size. The price is still expensive , but much cheaper than what you would find at a box box pet supply store. I ordered the sticks that state Angus beef, and could see they were a higher quality than the non-Angus I’ve purchased in the past and no objectionable odor. I wish they were cheaper but these are the sticks I’ll buy next time.
customer_reviews.author: Maltese Dog Family

customer_reviews.title: Competitive price, but average product
customer_reviews.text: Good variety of items from this company and cost is very competitive with other companies being a tad cheaper in general. The 'odor-free' should be removed from this product though. These are some of the worst smelling bully sticks I've ever purchased. I would say they last an average amount of time compared to other bully sticks I've had (10-15 minutes for my dog). My dog loves them, but due to the smell and the fact that my dog finishes them way too fast I will probably not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: timmah

customer_reviews.title: Truly Odor-free...mostly
customer_reviews.text: These bones are the most bizarre product I've ever bought. Initially, I bought the 12 count pack (current product being reviewed) and they were perfect. So, I figured I would save myself the headache of frequently having to rebuy and bought the 25 count package...big mistake. The 25 count bones stink HORRIBLY. Each time I've bought the 25 count package, they stink but the 12 count has always been perfect. I don't know if the manufacturer uses different bones for the two packagings but I'm going to be sticking with the 12 count offering from now on and just not order as frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I ordered 2 bags a few weeks ago, the 6 inch version and another 12 inch set. These are nothing like the other set. First off I thought I ordered the wrong set and also thought I would get the new packaging. I have the old packaging making me wonder how fresh these are, and they are terrible quality. My God loves bully sticks but it looks like I need to find a more reliable distributor.
customer_reviews.author: Soccerkidbs

customer_reviews.title: This will be a recurring purchase for me.
customer_reviews.text: This product is truly odor free. I purchased another brand of “odor free” sticks just to see if my husky puppy would chew on them. I bought this product based upon the claims by the manufacturer and the reviews on Amazon. Today I opened the package and let my dog go to town. I kept about six inches of the other product and conducted the smell test, side-by-side. This product wins hands down for the odor free claim. I will order more when I get close to the end of the bag. My dog loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Lea A.

customer_reviews.title: Only chew I trust for my little one
customer_reviews.text: Received the replacement package and unlike the first shipment, these ARE odor free......my 19-lb Chi-Pin loves them and I taught her how to role over if she wants one......she’ll come on my lap and just Stare at me.....and I’ll say WHAT? Then I’ll roll my eyes and try to guess what she wants(go potty? Go visit? Yum yum?) and I know what she wants! Then I say RollOver?????? And she gets all excited and jumps down on the floor....and I use my hand to guide her to lie down and then circle my hand and say role over.....once she does , we get up and go to the fridge.....aren’t they precious?
customer_reviews.author: springchiknot

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loved the first time I bought this (the first bag ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loved the first time I bought this (the first bag was stinkier and more inconsistent, and the second bag I liked because the pieces were more even and less stinky. They still liked them but weren’t as interested. The second bag had less “burnt” bully sticks so I was happy with that. Good deal for the price as long as they keep quality consistent I will keep buying these. There were just pieces in the first bag they got through in 5 minutes because it wasn’t... a solid stick? I have small dogs so that’s fast and didn’t keep them distracted long enough for me to get some work done.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa N

customer_reviews.title: It Says No Odor And There Is No Odor.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves bully sticks, ANY bully stick, even stinky ones so he's happy no matter what. I'M happy but there truly is NO oder to these, some have said there was, maybe their order got messed up but I ordered the NO ODOR Bully sticks, 12 pak and there really isn't an odor, not even when you open package. My only "complaint" is they are so expensive(all bully sticks are) and my dog can go through one in 3 days max. He's just med sized but has always been a determined and avid chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Young

customer_reviews.title: Not Odorless
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews. I believed the "odorless" description even though the photo didn't show the term "odorless" on the package. They are not odorless. When I opened the Amazon mailing envelope, the odor hit me in the face - and that's before I opened the actual bully package. I have returned them. Someone had posted they were told to "air them out" and that didn't work. I've never had to air any odorless sticks out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Watt

customer_reviews.title: Not Odor Free
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bully sticks for my puppy who chews endlessly. I have bought different brands in the past, and decided to try these because they claim to be ODOR FREE.....Well, they are not, they smell terrible...which pretty much defeats the purpose of me buying them. This was a complete dissappointment. My dog seems to like them but he doesn't care about the smell....Now of course since they were opened they cant be returned...I hate false advertising. The only reason i am giving two stars is because my dog is chewing on one today..if he leaves it by the wayside i will change the rating to be less...
customer_reviews.author: Heartwings15

customer_reviews.title: Good Batch
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews for several dog chews and bully sticks, these are best value for money. But lately there have been concerns/questions regarding the product safety. I hope they improve their quality and inspect every bully stick a they claim they do so. Anyways I recently purchased a new batch and my little beagle seems to be enjoying it. The sticks are fully filled and right length. Thickness did vary but it made up as some very medium and some very thick. Also received one extra bully stick which made me happy. But again, this puts in thoughts of whether they really inspect their products.
customer_reviews.author: Karishma Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Good choice.
customer_reviews.text: I think bully sticks are so overpriced, but this is across the board. That's why I can't say it's a great value. But for the quality, these are good. There are cheaper ones you can buy. But this brand sticks are consistently uniformed size, and of good quality. And no smell. Some of them from other sellers are really really bad. I've tried a lot and I come back to these.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Alice Kruesi

customer_reviews.title: My pup loves these
customer_reviews.text: Pros. My puppy loves these and they keep him occupied. If he is chewing on one of these he is not chewing on my furniture. Cons. A little bit on the pricey side. Although they say they are on scented they do have a smellThat I do not care for. It is less strong than the ones that do not say unscented though. I have 9 pound pup who can finish one in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Anastacia

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a puppy and a senior dog - both terriers. The puppy can chew on one of these bully sticks for a week, while the senior has one finished off in a couple of hours. That’s just how it is, no matter what bully sticks they get. But the low odor of these bully stick is a real pleasure without diminishing the pleasure the dogs get in chewing on them. The inspection process was reassuring as well.
customer_reviews.author: film fancier

customer_reviews.title: NOT odor free any more :-(
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this brand for years with no problems, but OMG, this batch isn't odor-free by any stretch of the imagination. The one other time I had stinky ones, it was my error for ordering the wrong kind. These say odor-free right on the package, but so much no. Dogs give them five stars, but they also eat deer poop.
customer_reviews.author: paperball

customer_reviews.title: Larger sticks are good — 50 lb dog enjoys them
customer_reviews.text: My 50 lb beagle-lab likes these. Scent is fine — luckily not strong, but not great. They last a while. Once my dog chews down to the last 4 inches she can’t get a good angle to hold/chew any more, so she either ignores it or swallows it whole. She sometimes throws up after swallowing it, which sucks. ( If you have a medium/big dog, buy these bigger 12” sticks — don’t even consider buying the small 6” versions).
customer_reviews.author: WALSTIB

customer_reviews.title: Great chew stick
customer_reviews.text: I got a larger size for my dogs so that it won't be devoured quickly. My vet recommended these flat chew sticks and to get the large ones. I only let them chew for 10 minutes. Each stick lasts about 3 - 4 days. They love it. It's a great quality and does not smell. I hope to keep buying this as long as the quality and price does not change.
customer_reviews.author: 925LH

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs I rescued . I have a 170lb English mastiff, 145 Neopoleon mastiff, 110lb Cane corso and 90 lb American bulldog. All my dogs love them. They don't last to long with these dogs but they enjoy them. When I leave I give them one and they are happy till I come home. These are thick and don't smell. Try it you will like it or should I say your dogs will like it. :)
customer_reviews.author: funtime

customer_reviews.title: Something safe for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Love having these to give to my dog when I need him to be distracted from me putting groceries away, or when grand kids visit..... So many reasons. He loves them but is a strong chewer so they don't last all that long. BUT they last long enough for me to get things done. hehe Glad I found these. I didn't like giving him raw hide bones. These seem much safer. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent distractions
customer_reviews.text: While pricey, these do provide a fairly long natural chewing experience for some dogs. I really like this brand better than others. The 12" is the best value. Made from tendon, so dense and chewy. I board dogs in my home, and these are a great distractions especially on rainy days or during thunderstorms.For smaller dogs, I have used heavy-duty bolt cutters to cut these down. I like to buy them when they are on sale! This company also makes a "junior" bully stick, but it is not made with tendon and is more of a snack than a chew. Checking ingredients is key. I always have had good communication and customer service from this provider, Best Bully Sticks.
customer_reviews.author: RavenhillTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly thin and definitely not odor free
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better than to order these and should have believed the reviews! These 12 inch bully sticks are the thinnest sticks I've ever seen. My German Shepherd broke one down in 2 minutes flat. They should cut these down for smaller dogs, they are useless for our big dogs. I've ordered from them before but this time I am disappointed that they would even send these thin things.
customer_reviews.author: MissMonaLisa2

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: My 27 lb mix breed puppy is an aggressive chewer and these last him longer than some of the other brands. I appreciate that they do not have a smell. Good value for the price considering the cost of some of the others.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lizard Leg

customer_reviews.title: My dog didn't like these much--he loves the smellier ones
customer_reviews.text: For me, they should get a 5 for the odor free factor. They still have a small smell, but not the usual ACCCK! However, my dog liked the ACKKKK and didn't care for these. He walks around whining and then wants outside where he buries them in his sand pile. It reminds me of that movie Harry & the Henderson when the Yeti brings the hunting trophies outside and buries them. They are excellent quality and he did chew a few of them.
customer_reviews.author: C Jones

customer_reviews.title: No odor / Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Your bully sticks are everything you advertise. I have 3 little dogs, all different breeds and ages and they love them! Keeps them out of trouble for hours. I was disappointed to find several badly bend sticks I had to cut up before I could give to them. I lost about a third of each stick but was afraid the sharp break could hurt them.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves These Too Much!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES LOVES LOVES these. The problem is that he's a 50lb standard poodle, and can chew through an entire one in an hour or so. That's a little too expensive for my tastes when I wanted something that would last him for a while. Also, these aren't exactly odor-free, so people sensitive to smells might not like being in the same room when their dog is chewing these. I didn't mind the smell, though.
customer_reviews.author: JLWelch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many chew products in search of one that lasts longer for puppy that's an aggressive chewer. These are it! It takes our pup a day or more of really working at one of these sticks vs. some other products we've tried that last maybe 10 minutes. I'll be buying these agian.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: These STINK!
customer_reviews.text: These are the stinkiest bully sticks I have ever found for my dogs! They are advertised as odor free. Not even close. I have tried many "odor free" brands and these are far and away the worse smelling I have ever come across. Please don't waste your money on these. You will be disappointed. I'm returning these for a refund. Can't even stand to be in the room with these smelly things. Dog's like them but, dogs like smelling poop too!
customer_reviews.author: rtm

customer_reviews.title: Not the best,, but they worked.
customer_reviews.text: Low odor. The issue was that they splintered and cracked while being chewed on. I've never seen any other bully sticks do this. The three that did this the worst I took away and threw out immediately. The others just seem to break in small pieces very quickly and didn't leave much to chew. It normally takes 45 minutes for our dog to chew through one of these. But this particular brand he was eating in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Sadowski

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love them and they aren't smelly.
customer_reviews.text: Picking chews that won't choke a dog but will keep big dogs busy for more than 10 minutes can be a challenge. Some bully sticks are just too stinky to allow the dogs to chew them in the house and the evening when I want to settle in is just the time when I like to give them something to chew quietly on the floor or couch while I cook. These are great. They meet all of my criteria and the dogs love them.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant traveler

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them!!
customer_reviews.text: I get these for my 4 year old dog. She’s a mix of Australian Cattle Dog and Corgi. She is absolutely crazy about them! They do have a slight odor to them, but it’s not enough to bother me too much compared to other brands. My dog usually gets one a day so I order these pretty frequently and the shipping is always super fast. I defiantly recommend these for all dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Mederm7

customer_reviews.title: A dog’s dream come true
customer_reviews.text: These are my dog’s favorite. I have seen lower priced bully sticks, but I would rather buy from a reputably sourced and locally manufactured product. You get what you pay for, and it’s true with dog treats too. Don’t cheap out on your furry family. You wouldn’t buy your kids some sketchy candy just because it LOOKED like the candy they like, but less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Safe and healthy!
customer_reviews.text: That little red dog is Lizzy a Tibetan Spaniel. Tibbies are an uncommon breed. They have short muzzles and wide mouths. Lizzy loves to chew, but rawhides are easily torn up and present a choking hazard. A friend recommended Bully sticks, so I gave them a try. It's been the perfect solution. This product safely takes care of her intense need to chew and she loves them. At a recent vet visit, the Doctor commented that she had the teeth of a much younger dog!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Stewart

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these bully sticks
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepard, mini Goldendoddle & Yorkie absolutely love these sticks. They do not smell & I can bearly keep enough of them. Our German Shepard chews his up pretty fast, he loves them so much but they are his favorite treat so I pay the price for them. Also, other treats seem to make him itch, so they work well for dogs. I would add a picture, but I’m waiting for my next order to arrive🐕🦮🐶
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Great product. They are a must for indoor dogs that love to chew stuff
customer_reviews.text: My pup LOVES them. The are not completely odor free but the smell is way better than the regular ones that smell horrible. I do wish the price was a little better. I buy the every 3 weeks. I can’t run out. My pup is 7months old and these keep him busy for hours and he doesn’t chew on my furniture.
customer_reviews.author: NatalieP

customer_reviews.title: Buy these. They are the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: A friend told me about these. They are a part of my dogs routine each day. Like an afternoon snack. I let him have about 1/4 to 1/3 of a stick per day. Ants love them too so don't leave them laying around outside. Place partially eaten sticks in a ziplok bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dean K.

customer_reviews.title: Small dog uses as 'calm down'
customer_reviews.text: Much in demand at our house. One dog uses them to calm down (was a street dog and gets very excited). She's small so I use loppers to cut them into 3" pieces. They do smell but that's probably part of the charm of this item for dogs. We've been buying regularly. They are usually consistent as far as size, but one shipment was quite thin and easy for dog to devour. Dog liked them but they don't serve the 'calm down' purpose. She also tosses them and then pounces on them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Your pup will love these!
customer_reviews.text: Have ordered these frequently - love that they are odor free ( just be sure to open the bag when you get them and let the moisture air out from the bag for a little while) our pups love these - they last and they digest well- fast delivery- just as described - great product !
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Airedale terrier
customer_reviews.text: I have a total of 4 dogs and they all love these. My youngest is an Airedale and she knows she gets one a day. She stares up at the box they sit in wondering if she can get it herself. They have been a lifesaver for this dog because she loves to chew and it keeps her content for a bit. She does finish one in one sitting but she is a large dog.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bird

customer_reviews.title: They are Odor Free!!
customer_reviews.text: Mom here, our puppy loves these. I gave her one Tuesday Night and I don't let her have the whole thing in a day. I put it down again yesterday and again today for her and it's a slow process for her to eat them so I'm happy about that. I am always around when she has edible things like this to make sure she doesn't choke. Will buy these again! It's worth the price for Odor Free!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy BB

customer_reviews.title: Best Bully Sticks Ever
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes crazy for these bully sticks. She will turn her head away from other treats until I give her a bully stick. It keeps her occupied and happy. I have them on auto delivery so I don't run out. It's a tragedy around my house if I let her bully sticks run out. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Renee Balke

customer_reviews.title: Terrible delivery
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved these my dogs love them. However, amazon did not leave it in a secure place. They just threw it over and my dogs got to it before I got home. All they had to do is put it on top of the trash can. Not happy with that amazon 😡
customer_reviews.author: Mstormy

customer_reviews.title: Good value compared to competition
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to like, goes to crate readily and the chew will last for an hour or more. I generally cut in half or even fourths to last longer as for as a treat. I was asked to give a star rating for the flavor. I have not tasted it but Bridget seems to like the flavor
customer_reviews.author: Pappie

customer_reviews.title: The dog likes them.
customer_reviews.text: I just got a dog from the Humane Society. The "foster parent" sent a bag of bully sticks with her. I wasn't familiar with the product. The dog is a finicky eater and won't touch other dog bisquits or dog treats, but not only loves the bully sticks, but will settle right down and start chewing when you give her one. I think they're a bit expensive, but the dog is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: first chew that lasted longer than an hour.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Great Dane and a 9lb terrier mix. Every (including rawhide) chew I have tried has lasted less than an hour. The terrier mix loves to chew, If he doesn't have a chew toy, he will find something to chew on. These have lasted over 24 hours and the dogs are still enjoying them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for listening!
customer_reviews.text: I am once again updating my review. (07/18/18) As you can see, we order these a lot. With 2 Dobermans, we are always looking for a chew reward that lasts at least an hour. Although these orders have been very inconsistent, we were very pleased with our most recent order. Thank you for listening and delivering a quality product once again! Previous review: I ordered these and they are not the oder free, free range, grass fed beef bully sticks I purchased last time. What's going on?? Plus, these stink and are sourced out of Brazil. :(
customer_reviews.author: RJH

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of research before we tried these. They have been a life saver for our two puppies. Every time they would try to chew on something they were not suppose to I would replace the item with a Bully stick. It has saved us with their chewing. Funny I bought so many chew toys for them and these did the trick to satisfice their teething. Bonus our older dog loves them too!
customer_reviews.author: Barbee

customer_reviews.title: These bones appear to be safe.
customer_reviews.text: My little puppy loves to chew on these. He's very small and I was afraid to give him a chew bone. AKC recommended these. He has been able to scuff the bone up but it has not splintered in any way nor has it strung out in that white stretchy goo that can break off and cause choking. My tiny puppy has been working on one bone for a month and gotten nowhere on it. This package will last years at this rate.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: These are a good value. Smaller then expected & compared to others, my puppy was not over the moon for these particular billy sticks. Normally he spends a long time & is fully engaged in the bully stick but not too much time is spent on these. They are good but not the best. Perhaps due to the very minimal odor on these. These last long but he’s just not interested for very long with these to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: Bully sticks are expensive! But these seem a good value, and they are clean and nicely packaged (although I put them in a canister when I get them), and my dog is very happy to get one. The chewing gives her some good exercise and helps her calm down. She also gets one when the gardeners or visitors come, and she has to go in her crate...
customer_reviews.author: kkg17

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chewing Puppies
customer_reviews.text: I have a nine week old Australian Shepherd puppy and she likes to chew. She loves the Bully Sticks and chews on them throughout the day.The sticks are solid stay intact while the puppy chews. It eventually breaks down but it takes a long time. If my puppy starts to chew on something else I just replace it with a Bully Stick. I give the product the highest recommendation because it solves the chewing problem.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves these
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for years. A little expensive, but worth it. I give it to her while watching TV and hold it so I can work it around her mouth to chew on all teeth from incisors to molars. One problem is what to do with the nub at the end. I used to throw it away, but now give her the last inch and she chews on it and swallows it. No problems comming out so far.... A little expensive but the best brand I have found. Party Girl 49 # mini goldendooldle
customer_reviews.author: Lee J Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Our dog almost had an ER visit due to swallowing a 2 inch piece of this. Letting your dog chew on these is asking for a digestive track blockage.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hassett

customer_reviews.title: Neighborhood full of puppies loves them!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for... a chew that took some time for my 16-week old puppy to get through. She seems to like them a lot and it keeps her occupied for a good amount of time. We shared them with other pups in the neighborhood and every one of them was happy to have one. We will definitely be reordering!
customer_reviews.author: amazonedie

customer_reviews.title: Be Advised
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these things. But unfortunately, after the first few orders, they just keep getting thinner and thinner. It's very inconsistent. Some in the pack will be thick and last a while, but the majority are as thin as a pencil and my dogs finish them before I can even sit down for dinner. It's pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: keeps our dog quiet and happy.
customer_reviews.text: The dog is the judge - his favorite treat. happy tail wags when I show him the bully stick. No upset tummy afterwards. A godsend when a lot of coming and going in the house - takes his time and quietly enjoys his treat - time to play and visit afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: patburns

customer_reviews.title: NOT odor free
customer_reviews.text: I bring my dog to work with me and needed something to entertain him during the day. I bought odorless sticks so as not to disturb the nostrils of my coworkers. ........they were disturbed.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have a teething puppy and I tried everything from nylabones to filled kongs. Nothing would keep her attention longer than 5 minutes. One day I was at a local store and tried a redbarn bullystick. They are 7 dollars each. To my relief, she uses them. Now that I found what she likes, it was time to shop. I came across these. I must say I am very pleased and highly recommend them. They barely smell. I can only smell them on her breath. The redbarn ones I could smell across the room, no exaggeration. And these are A FRACTION of the cost. I hope they are as pure as advertised because I will be a returning buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: No bully stick is odor-free
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the great value for the size & quantity of bully sticks. I’m very happy with them overall. They’re really high quality bully sticks. They last hours for my little chihuahua mix & maybe an hour or so for my lab mix. NOTE: while the smell may be very slightly less intense with these, you will never find a true bully stick that is free from odor... and these are no exception. They smell :D
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The smell is awful but my dog loves it & I love her enough to deal with it. She chews on it for hours and is supper content. I give her one if I’m going to be gone for a few hours & when I return she is almost done. I love that my pup no longer chews on shoes & wood.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Kinda stinky, variable thickness of sticks
customer_reviews.text: Kinda stinky, but not too bad. Great value. Variable sizes/thickness of the sticks in the package, but my dog (35 lb) doesn't complain! He can finish one of these entire things in one evening though, so they're an expensive treat but still better price than local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: SDBritaB

customer_reviews.title: My dog got very sick from these!!!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy LOVES to chew (naturally), and these seemed like a great, natural option for a snack. We gave these to her ONE time and the next day she had diarrhea with no other changes in diet. According to the vet, this is not uncommon for bully sticks and it was not simply an instance of a sensitive stomach. I won’t say this happens in every case, I’m sure it doesn’t, but this is a far more risky product for your dog’s health than manufacturers would have you believe. Even my research on-line found vets endorsing these, but discussing it with other breeders and vets the problems are far more widespread than usually reported.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Bujak

customer_reviews.title: Not for small dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My dog just had to have surgery from these. She was chewing in one and I heard a large crack, it was her back tooth. And the vet says one of her other teeth is cracked and two back ones need pulled from this. Do not give this to small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Buy These Dicks
customer_reviews.text: 2nd Review Apparently the 2nd package was not treated the same way because these STINK TO HIGH HEAVEN! I did get a subscription for them because my pups still love them, but they smell like a men's urinal! GAG! If I continue to receive the ones that stink, I will cancel my subscription. Not sure what the difference is.....just beware. 1st Review My pups love love love these! They don't stink like other brands (do your know what they are?? Bull dicks! Haha...seriously folks!) Our Littles go nuts for these...even our persnickety Princess!
customer_reviews.author: Shoults

customer_reviews.title: Kind of smelly
customer_reviews.text: I heard these were less smelly than other brands, but still. Also be aware that it can be a choke hazard if it gets whittled down too low. You really have to keep your eye on your dog because they seem to love these. Oh...high caloric from what I've heard so if you are concerned about your dog's weight, don't feed them too often.
customer_reviews.author: MAEB

customer_reviews.title: Bully Sticks: No longer a viable treat
customer_reviews.text: All these bully stick companies have long had zero quality control. This batch was the stinkiest, smallest diameter beef pizzle that I've bought. This is the "ULTRA thick" labeled bag of 12. Fifty bucks all but wasted. Bully sticks are no longer economical due to demand. Do yourself a favor and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Cruentis

customer_reviews.title: Golden Approved
customer_reviews.text: My Two Goldens love them. Keeps them busy while enjoying a good chew. The anticipation when I head to the cabinet to get them is hysterical as they sit nicely patiently waiting with very concerned expressions.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Goldens

customer_reviews.title: Named Best for good reason.
customer_reviews.text: These are the thickest and densest bully sticks around. They are also the only brand that doesn't give my power chewer diarrhea. My picture shows the thickness compared to my pointer finger. Update...he did get diarrhea with this batch. Never happened before. I had ordered many times and swore by them. Unfortunately this was my last order.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Good price for quality bullies
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been purchasing bullies from Best Bully Sticks for years. The quality has always been high. I hesitated before purchasing odor-free bullies. I I would guess that the smell holds some appeal to dogs, and I’ve never minded the smell. But, my boy loved these just the same. He’s a 40 lb dog & an aggressive chewer. These sticks are relatively thick, but he finishes 1 in about 30 min. Their country of origin is Brazil.
customer_reviews.author: NinaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quality thick bully sticks and very cost effective compared to local stores.
customer_reviews.text: These are some solid bully sticks! And for the price compared to what they are in the stores around here, this is a fantastic deal. They do seem to be odor-free from what I can tell, but I also do not stick my face around where my dog is chewing. They last a decent amount of time, usually around a day for my dog to get through one.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: They are too skinny
customer_reviews.text: These sticks are very skinny, only 2 in the entire pack is medium. I have been buying them for 3 years but I will try to find another maker, they are too expensive to waste money on small ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Dean

customer_reviews.title: They give my dog the runs.
customer_reviews.text: She loves them but has had diarrhea pretty much her entire life. We changed everything, food, treats. We didn't ever expect it was the bully sticks, but finally through the process of elimination... I cut the bully sticks. And just like that. Firm poops.
customer_reviews.author: Manly Stuwart

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be...
customer_reviews.text: When I first started getting these, I thought they were great. They were thick and took my French Bulldog awhile to chew down to 4" when I would take it away, and occasionally, there were thin sticks that would have long strips tear off that I'd have to take away because she would choke on them. Now ALL OF THE STICKS ARE THIN AND STRIP EASILY. Certainly not worth the money they're charging. Even the ones that don't strip chew down MUCH, MUCH, more quickly than they used to.
customer_reviews.author: NLB214

customer_reviews.title: Less gross but not longlasting
customer_reviews.text: These are much less smelly than other bully sticks I have purchased. They also did not make my dog sick even though she chowed the whole thing in one sitting and she has a very sensitive stomach. She seriously loved it. However the big con is that they only lasted about 20-30 minutes- which I was surprised at. That's why I gave it an overall 3 stars. If you are looking for something less disgusting and scary than other dog treats and you don't have an aggressive chewer, or are looking for a "treat" rather than a long-lasting chew, this product will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: No longer odor free
customer_reviews.text: Well the sticks are billed as being order free and the ones in the previous packaging seemed to be but these are not. I mean, they’re still okay. They’re just a little greasy and very smelly and since I know less smelly ones are available I may look for those. You just might want to take that off your messaging now since it’s not true. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Can't vouch for them myself, but my dog loves them. :-)
customer_reviews.text: Our three month old labradoodle absolutely loves these bully sticks. We give them to her to chew on a couple of hours a day and they last about 3 to 4 days. We do need to keep an eye on the last remaining few inches, as I think it can be a choking hazard. And true to the manufacturers claim, they are almost odor-free. The thickness range in size from that of a thick Crayola marker to about three times that thickness. And buying them in packs of 12 makes much more affordable than getting them individually from stores.
customer_reviews.author: Calindian

customer_reviews.title: Quality bulkysticks!
customer_reviews.text: I buy this monthly for my 62lb pitbull. It keeps her busy for approx 30 minutes which is great for me because she's always on top of me (she's so loving) :) !! I prefer bullysticks because they're all natural and good for her digestive system and teeth. There is a slight odor but it's bearable.
customer_reviews.author: NiBiJo

customer_reviews.title: So thin and split
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these before and they were great but this last bunch are split and so thin and sharp my cocker spaniel blows through it in minutes it’s a little scary I should of sent them back hopefully the next bag won’t be as bad but my dog loves them so I keep them on hand
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Van Fossen

customer_reviews.title: Very BIG!
customer_reviews.text: I am returning these because the picture, in my opinion, did not show how thick they are. If you have a very large dog they would be OK. They are way too big and hard for my 10 pound Shi-Poo.
customer_reviews.author: Carol N.

product_meta.title: Best Bully Sticks Odor-Free Angus Bully Sticks - Made of All-Natural, Free-Range, Grass-Fed Angus Beef - Hand-Inspected and USDA/FDA-Approved
feature_bullets: 100% All-Natural Angus Beef: Our bully sticks are made from high-quality, free-range, grass-fed angus beef
Promotes Dental Health: Durable and long-lasting, our bully sticks scrape away tartar and plaque through chewing action
High in Protein: Each bully stick is packed with protein and other essential vitamins to support a healthy diet
Fully Digestible: Made of natural beef, these 100% digestible dog chews never splinter and are totally safe for your pet
Excellent Alternative to Rawhide: Our bully sticks are free of any additives, hormones or unhealthy chemicals

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
